name: BiMap
comment: A bi-directional map whose key-value pairs form a one-to-one correspondence. BiMaps support an inverse property which gives access to an inverted view of the map, such that there is a mapping (v, k) for each pair (k, v) in the original map. Since a one-to-one key-value invariant applies, it is an error to insert duplicate values into this map. It is also an error to insert null keys or values into this map.

inverse.name: inverse
inverse.comment: Returns the inverse of this map, with key-value pairs (v, k) for each pair (k, v) in this map.

constructors.comment: Creates a BiMap instance with the default implementation.

[]=.comment:
Adds an association between key and value.

Throws dart-core.ArgumentError if an association involving quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.[]=.value exists in the map; otherwise, the association is inserted, overwriting any existing association for the key.

replace.name: replace
replace.comment:
Replaces any existing associations(s) involving key and value.

If an association involving quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.replace.key or quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.replace.value exists in the map, it is removed.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

keys.name: keys
keys.comment:
The keys of this.

The returned iterable has efficient length and contains operations, based on quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.length and quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.containsKey of the map.

The order of iteration is defined by the individual Map implementation, but must be consistent between changes to the map.

values.name: values
values.comment:
The values of this.

The values are iterated in the order of their corresponding keys. This means that iterating quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.keys and quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.values in parrallel will provided matching pairs of keys and values.

The returned iterable has an efficient length method based on the quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.length of the map.

length.name: length
length.comment: The number of key-value pairs in the map.

isEmpty.name: isEmpty
isEmpty.comment: Returns true if there is no key-value pair in the map.

isNotEmpty.name: isNotEmpty
isNotEmpty.comment: Returns true if there is at least one key-value pair in the map.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

[].comment: Returns the value for the given quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.[].key or null if quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.[].key is not in the map. Because null values are supported, one should either use quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.containsKey to distinguish between an absent key and a null value, or use the quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.putIfAbsent method.

[]=.comment:
Associates the quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.[]=.key with the given quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.[]=.value.

If the key was already in the map, its associated value is changed. Otherwise the key-value pair is added to the map.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

containsValue.name: containsValue
containsValue.comment: Returns true if this map contains the given value.

containsKey.name: containsKey
containsKey.comment: Returns true if this map contains the given key.

putIfAbsent.name: putIfAbsent
putIfAbsent.comment:
If quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.putIfAbsent.key is not associated to a value, calls quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.putIfAbsent.ifAbsent and updates the map by mapping quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.putIfAbsent.key to the value returned by quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.putIfAbsent.ifAbsent. Returns the value in the map.

Map<String, int> scores = {'Bob': 36};
for (var key in ['Bob', 'Rohan', 'Sophena']) {
  scores.putIfAbsent(key, () => key.length);
}
scores['Bob'];      // 36
scores['Rohan'];    //  5
scores['Sophena'];  //  7

The code that quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.putIfAbsent.ifAbsent executes must not add or remove keys.

addAll.name: addAll
addAll.comment:
Adds all key-value pairs of quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.addAll.other to this map.

If a key of quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.addAll.other is already in this map, its value is overwritten.

The operation is equivalent to doing this[key] = value for each key and associated value in other. It iterates over quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.addAll.other, which must therefore not change during the iteration.

remove.name: remove
remove.comment: Removes the association for the given quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.remove.key. Returns the value for quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.remove.key in the map or null if quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.remove.key is not in the map. Note that values can be null and a returned null value does not always imply that the key is absent.

clear.name: clear
clear.comment:
Removes all pairs from the map.

After this, the map is empty.

forEach.name: forEach
forEach.comment:
Applies quiver/quiver-collection.BiMap.forEach.f to each {key, value} pair of the map.

Adding or removing keys from the map during iteration is not allowed.
